pr_title: Report failure to compile pushed down filter as COMPILE_ERROR

timeline.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText:
Catching UncheckedExecutionException doesn't seem to work here unfortunately :( I think because the thrown exception's class and UncheckedExecutionException class are loaded by different classloaders. That is why even a simple check like e instanceOf UncheckedExecutionException doesn't work and we may just have to stick to a class name check.
Just to be sure I tried this on a verifier cluster and it throws the HIVE_CANNOT_OPEN_SPLIT error like before since it doesn't enter the catch (UncheckedExecutionException e) { block. (Can share the link and logs in chat if you are interested)
replies.author: sujay-jain

replies.bodyText:
And I'm curious about closing the orcDataSource. Doing this in a finally block will close it even in cases when there's no exception, and at a cusrory glance it seems like callers of this function could still use it..
Unrelated to this PR but should we be closing the orcDataSource in OrcSelecticePageSource#close() method instead? here
replies.author: sujay-jain

replies.bodyText: @sujay-jain Thanks for explaining. Makes sense. For the benefit of future readers, would you add a comment explaining why you are comparing exception class manually?
replies.author: mbasmanova
bhhari

timeline.message:

Before this change this error was  reported as STORAGE_ERROR:
Error opening Hive split.

timeline.bodyText:
also talk about why .class comparison does not work either, can be something like
instanceof and class comparison do not work as they are loaded by different class loaders.
